result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristina Lynn Fults was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $50.00 plus all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 03-03-16 or serve 20 consecutive days in HOC.

08-26-15/ John Siefert
The defendants request to release privileges is granted.
The Defendant may be released for the following:  CHILD CARE
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and school. Can be served on ES. Court STAYED the commencement until 07-20-15

records.addlTxt: Warrant was faxed to Sheriff's Department, Commitment is paid in full.
F&C Commitment issued for total balance due of $486.00 ($476 + $10).  20 days HOC, consecutive.  Due & owing
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.

Order signed and filed on 2-23-16.

The Court has reviewed the defendant's submission and GRANTS the request.

The fine, costs and surcharges shall be paid on or before February 1, 2017.  

Special terms:  Pay at least $50.00 per month commencing March 1, 2016.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. spc
Reflects 08-26-15 Court order granting Huber for child care
The defendant's request for release privileges is granted. Defendant may be released for the following:  child care. Copies forwarded to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. crt
Defendant's pro se request for Huber for childcare.

Defendant Kristina Lynn Fults in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and school. Can be served on ES.  Court stayed the commencment until 7-20-15. 

Fine of $50.00 plus all mandatory  costs. fees and surcharges  to be paid by 3-3-16 or serve 20 consecutive days in the House of Correction. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Kristina Lynn Fults in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47.   Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-03-2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 04-15-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kristina Lynn Fults
Current: 5864 South Hately Avenue, Cudahy, WI 53110   (Effective: 03-11-2015)
Prior: 5864 South Hately Avenue, Cudahy, WI 53110

Defendant Kristina Lynn Fults in court.  Anthony E. White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-11-2015 at 1:30pm
